C. Move the web and database servers onto the same VXLAN.

VXLAN (Virtual Extensible LAN) is a network virtualization technology that allows for the creation of virtual networks on top of physical networks. By moving the web and database servers onto the same VXLAN, the systems administrator can create a logical segmentation of the network, reducing the amount of traffic between the servers, and thus reducing the load on the network.

Selected Answer: B
B. Link aggregation would BEST address the issue of a physical switchport connected to a virtualization host using all available bandwidth.

Link aggregation, often referred to as "bonding" or "teaming," combines multiple physical network links into a single logical link. This provides increased bandwidth, fault tolerance, and load balancing. In the context of a virtualization host using all available bandwidth, implementing link aggregation would allow the host to utilize the combined bandwidth of multiple physical links, thus alleviating congestion and ensuring efficient use of network resources. This can significantly improve network performance for the virtualized environment.

B. Link aggregation would be the best option to address this issue. Link aggregation is a technique that combines multiple physical connections between two network devices into one logical connection, thereby increasing the bandwidth and providing redundancy. By using link aggregation, the physical switchport can use all available bandwidth and avoid becoming a bottleneck for the virtualization host.

Microsegmentation is a security method of managing network access between workloads. With microsegmentation, administrators can manage security policies that limit traffic based on the principle of least privilege and Zero Trust. Organizations use microsegmentation to reduce the attack surface, improve breach containment and strengthen regulatory compliance.
